common_issues.title: Pieces OS installation and connection issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems with Pieces OS installation and integration with other applications. Issues include missing com.pieces.os directory, authentication flow errors, and websocket connection failures.  Reinstallation, checking firewall settings, and verifying Pieces OS version compatibility are suggested troubleshooting steps.

related_issues.title: com.pieces.os does not exist
related_issues.text:
com.pieces.os does not exist
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces OS: 12.1.0 Pieces for Developers: 4.3.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I installed UltraEdit on my Windows 11 computer (ARM), running Windows Home. After installing, creating an account, etc. I started UltraEdit and was looking forward to the integration. What I was met with was a window that said that Pieces isn't running with an error unable to determine Pieces connection port. After some discussion, UltraEdit team said that I was likely missing the file %USERPROFILE%\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Config\.port.txt
Turns out I'm missing the directory com.pieces.os. I has not been created. I uninstalled all the Pieces apps and reinstalled from the website, hoping that this directory would be created. Now UltraEdit says Pieces for Developers is not installed and prompts me to Download Pieces. Clicking that link takes me directly to the page I just downloaded from.
I suggested to UltraEdit support that I could recreate the directory structure and add .port.txt, but they said instead that I should contact you. While you are looking at this, I am going to do a complete uninstall of UltraEdit and Pieces components, deleting any registry keys I can find (as uninstall doesn't remove any), and remove the .pieces_identites folder from Documents, then do a complete reinstall.
Looking forward to a solution to this.
Regards,
Ian Hannah

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Authentication and connection issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulty signing in and connecting to Pieces OS across different versions and operating systems.  Reported errors include authentication flow failures, 404 errors for websocket connections, and generic "sign in to continue" prompts.  Troubleshooting steps like browser changes, extension disabling, and reinstallation have not resolved the issue.  Logs indicate potential problems with core services and authentication endpoints.

common_issues.title: Pieces macOS app and Raycast extension update issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces macOS app and its Raycast extension. The app update process gets stuck in a loop, and the extension is incompatible with recent Raycast versions, displaying error messages.  Users are unable to access Pieces functionality due to these update problems. This appears to affect users on macOS 12.1.0 and may be related to Pieces OS version compatibility.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. related_issues.title: Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

If I start Pieces Desktop, it tells me it's out of date.

When I click on "check for Desktop App updates" the loader loads to about 40% on the icon and then restarts the app and I get the exact same message.
So it seems your updater is stuck in a loop.

common_issues.title: Pieces Copilot/OS Inaccessibility Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues accessing Pieces Copilot and/or Pieces OS.  Problems include Home/End keys not working in VS Code extension, inability to open Copilot service with 'fp' instance error, and websocket connection failures with 404 errors when opening core services.  These issues appear across different OS versions (Windows, MacOS) and Pieces versions. Further investigation into Pieces backend services and VS Code extension integration is needed.

related_issues.title: Home and End Keyboard Keys do not scroll to beginning and end of prompt in Visual Studio Extension
related_issues.text:
Home and End Keyboard Keys do not scroll to beginning and end of prompt in Visual Studio Extension
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

5.0.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When writing a prompt in the Pieces Copilot window, Home and End keys change the active window in Visual Studio instead of scrolling to the beginning and text of the current line.

When I try the same in GitHub Copilot, it correctly scrolls, which suggest this is specific to Pieces and not a misconfigured VS shortcut.

This is annoying because I use these keys a lot. 

Thank you.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7666071d-e62f-446d-8876-750d1de19953)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App on macOS update issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems updating the Pieces desktop app on macOS.  Symptoms include the app reporting it's out of date, update checks failing or looping, and workstream activities not updating.  This affects various Pieces OS versions.  Further investigation is needed to determine the root cause and solution.

related_issues.title: Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
related_issues.text:
Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I opened #753.
Now, Today's workstream is being updated but still I can't update last week activities with refresh button(select last week)

Is it good to think I can't revive last week tasks or I will be fixed?

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

If I start Pieces Desktop, it tells me it's out of date.

When I click on "check for Desktop App updates" the loader loads to about 40% on the icon and then restarts the app and I get the exact same message.
So it seems your updater is stuck in a loop.


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the Pieces OS installation and connection issues, focusing on the 'com.pieces.os does not exist' error and authentication flow failures.
Investigate and address the Pieces macOS app and Raycast extension update issues to ensure compatibility and functionality.
Troubleshoot the Pieces Copilot/OS inaccessibility problems, specifically the Home/End keys issue in VS Code, 'fp' instance error, and websocket connection failures.
Improve the Pieces Desktop App update process on macOS to prevent looping and ensure successful updates.
Review and update documentation and troubleshooting guides for common issues related to installation, authentication, and updates.
